Description: Terracotta figure fragment representing the hoof of an animal, possibly a camel. Well-levigated Delta silt. Core ranges from 7.5YR 4/2 (Weak Red) to lOR S/8 (Red) shading to gray on the interior. Finely ground (sand-sized to 1 mm) white, gray, and red grit temper, with frequent micaceous inclusions of similar size. A thick 7.SYR 4/6 (Red) to 3/6 (Dark Red) slip covers the exterior.
Curator's comments: Dating based upon the context. Two pieces were found together and thought to come from the same figure. A tentative parallel of a young Harpocrates (carrying an ovoid pot) riding on a camel was suggested by Leonard (Dunand 1990, 87, no.184).
Bibliographic references: Leonard 2001 / Ancient Naukratis: Excavations at a Greek Emporion in Egypt, Part II: The excavations at Kom Hadid. (p. 172, no.15 pl. 3.14a, b.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.061) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: pl. 3.14a,b, p. 172. no.16 (catalogue number)
